com.github.dandelion.extras.cache.ehcache
Class EhCacheAssetCache

java.lang.Object
  com.github.dandelion.core.asset.cache.spi.AbstractAssetCache
      com.github.dandelion.extras.cache.ehcache.EhCacheAssetCache
All Implemented Interfaces:
AssetCache
public class EhCacheAssetCache
extends AbstractAssetCache

EhCache implementation of the AssetCache.

The initialization of this cache has two prerequisites: obtain a CacheManager instance and a ehcache.xml configuration file.

The CacheManager instance is obtained using the following strategy:

  • First tries to get an existing CacheManager using the cache.manager.name configuration property.
  • If no CacheManager is configured, a default one is created.

Once the CacheManager obtained, then the configuration file is loaded using the following strategy:

  • First checks if the cache.configuration.location configuration property exists and uses this path to load the file.
  • If the above configuration property is not used, scans the classpath (starting from the root) for the ehcache.xml configuration file.

Note that Dandelion uses a cache called dandelionCache. If it doesn't exist in your ehcache.xml configuration file, Dandelion will automatically add and use it.

Note finally that the same cache is used for two purposes:

  • Store the content of Assets that are served by the DandelionServlet
  • Store the set of Assets to be displayed on a page, for a given request, thus avoiding location resolution and processing

Since:
0.10.0
Author:
Thibault Duchateau
